text: that Rodri phillips who's the fourth
five counts and david's has decided to
abandon his appeal against his
conviction for sending menacing messages
to the anti brexit campaigner gina
miller our legal correspondent Clive
Coleman is at Southwark Crown Court and
has been following events in court
forests Clive bring us up to date well
it was a fairly dramatic turnaround in
court this morning robbery Phillips
arrived at court accompanied by a number
of supporters he was due to make this
appeal against his sentence but before
that appeal started judge Deborah Taylor
who is the senior judge sitting at this
court advised Rodri Phillips's barrister
Oliver Brancusi that the court having
read the papers in the case had to
advise Rodri Phillips that there was a
risk that if the appeal proceeded that
the sentence the set of the original 12
week sentence that was imposed at
Westminster magistrates court back in
July that that sentence could be
increased that led mr. brunt to ask for
some time to advise his client he had
some 15 minutes to do so and when he
returned to court he advised the court
that having considered the indication
that Judge Taylor had given that the
appeal would be abandoned now the effect
of that is that the 12-week sentence
that was originally imposed Lord said
David's had served some five days of
that when he put in his appeal he was
then given bail pending the hearing of
the appeal so he will now serve the
remainder of that sentence by my maths
that some 11 weeks and two days of
course it will be subject to early
release provisions but it was a fairly
dramatic turnaround because mr. Bronte
indicated that the advice had already
been given to vie counsel Davis that
there was a possibility there it always
is a possibility when you appeal against
sentence that the sentence could indeed
be increased so that advice had been
given before today's hearing but as it
were mr. Brandt I'm paraphrasing him
said having heard
as it were from the judge personally
advice was taken that issue was
reconsidered and the appeal was
abandoned so as I say he will now serve
the remainder of the sentence
